question.title: Even Odd Game
question.content:
Given a number n, number of apples in a bag. You and your friend are picking one apple turnwise from the bag. It is given that the first attempt is always by you. The person picking the last apple will be the winner. 

  • If you will win: print "You" (without quotes)
  • If your friend will win: print "Friend" (without quotes)

Examples:

Input: n = 9
Output: You
Input: n = 4
Output: Friend

Constraints:
1 <= n <= 100

rephrased.body: You and your friend are taking turns picking apples from a bag containing 'n' apples. You go first. The person who picks the last apple wins. Determine who will win the game.

hints:
Java:


if (number % 2 == 0) {
    System.out.print("Friend");
} else {
    System.out.print("You");
}

CPP:

if (number % 2 == 0) {
    cout<<"Friend";
} else {
    cout<<"You";
}

C:

if (number % 2 == 0) {
    printf("Friend");
} else {
    printf("You");
}
